  • src.integrator.progress_plot

Source code for src.integrator.progress_plot

"""
A plotter that can be used for combined solves

Currently, this makes live plot.  It could be mod'ed to just save them to outputs
"""

from matplotlib import pyplot as plt, ticker

# some defaults

styles = {
    'H2': {'color': 'tab:blue', 'linestyle': 'dashed', 'alpha': 0.7},
    'ELEC': {'color': 'tab:orange', 'linestyle': 'dashdot', 'alpha': 0.7},
    'Load': {'color': 'tab:green', 'linestyle': 'solid', 'alpha': 0.7},
    'Price': {'color': 'tab:cyan', 'linestyle': 'solid', 'alpha': 0.7},
}




[docs]
def plot_it(
    h2_price_records=[],
    elec_price_records=[],
    h2_obj_records=[],
    elec_obj_records=[],
    h2_demand_records=[],
    elec_demand_records=[],
    load_records=[],
    elec_price_to_res_records=[],
):
    """cheap plotter of iterative progress"""

    fig, [ax1, ax2, ax3, ax4] = plt.subplots(4, 1, sharex=True, constrained_layout=True)  # type: ignore
    ax1_b = ax1.twinx()
    ax2_b = ax2.twinx()
    # ax2.set_yscale('log')
    ax3_b = ax3.twinx()
    ax4_b = ax4.twinx()
    ax4_b.set_yscale('log')

    # Labelling
    ax1.set_title('Cross-Demands of...')
    ax2.set_title('Price')
    ax4.set_title('OBJ Value')
    ax4.set_xlabel('Iteration')
    ax1.set_ylabel('H2')
    ax2.set_ylabel('H2')
    ax4.set_ylabel('H2')
    ax1_b.set_ylabel('ELEC')
    ax2_b.set_ylabel('ELEC')
    ax4_b.set_ylabel('ELEC')
    ax3.set_ylabel('Load')
    ax3_b.set_ylabel('Price')
    ax3.set_title('Res Model Load & Price')

    ax1.plot(*list(zip(*h2_demand_records)), label='H2', **styles['H2'])
    ax1_b.plot(*list(zip(*elec_demand_records)), label='ELEC', **styles['ELEC'])

    ax2.plot(*list(zip(*h2_price_records)), label='H2', **styles['H2'])
    ax2_b.plot(*list(zip(*elec_price_records)), label='ELEC', **styles['ELEC'])

    p3 = ax3.plot(*list(zip(*load_records)), label='Load', **styles['Load'])
    p4 = ax3_b.plot(*list(zip(*elec_price_to_res_records)), label='Price', **styles['Price'])
    ax3.legend(handles=p3 + p4, reverse=True)

    p1 = ax4.plot(*list(zip(*h2_obj_records)), label='H2', **styles['H2'])
    p2 = ax4_b.plot(*list(zip(*elec_obj_records)), label='ELEC', **styles['ELEC'])

    # set the x-ticks to be on integer (iteration) values
    tick_spacing = 1
    ax4.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MultipleLocator(tick_spacing))

    # grid it
    ax1.grid(True)
    ax2.grid(True)
    ax3.grid(True)
    ax4.grid(True)

    ax4.legend(handles=p1 + p2, reverse=True)
    plt.show()
